channel.title: Revise - A Level Sociology Revision
channel.description: Let other students help you revise for your A Level Sociology exams. In this series, students break down complicated revision subjects to its core components helping you rock your exams. Find your FREE online course here: http://bit.ly/30id5tm
channel.author: Seneca Learning Revision
channel.itunes:author: Seneca Learning Revision
channel.itunes:summary: Let other students help you revise for your A Level Sociology exams. In this series, students break down complicated revision subjects to its core components helping you rock your exams. Find your FREE online course here: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Socialisation: Secondary Socialisation with Peer Groups 🏢 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
Emma looks at the secondary socialisation that occurs within peer groups and the workplace for your A level Sociology exam. She looks at peer-group pressure as well as norms related to age. Perfect for the AQA exam board. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

Click here for the full course, or visit this link: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Socialisation: Secondary Socialisation at School 🏫 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
This week, Emma looks at the secondary socialisation that occurs at school for your A level Sociology exam. She goes through the idea of the hidden curriculum, as well as attitudes from functionalists, Marxists and feminists. Perfect for the AQA exam board. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

Click here for the full course, or visit this link: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Socialisation: Primary Socialisation at Home 👨‍👩‍👧‍👧 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
This week, Emma looks at the primary socialisation that occurs at home for your A level Sociology exam. She goes through the attitudes towards primary socialisation of functionalists, Marxists and feminists. Perfect for the AQA exam board. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

item.title: Identities: Types of Identities 🎭 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
This week, Emma looks at the social construction of identity for your A level Sociology exam. She goes through the concept of mixed and stigmatised identities. Perfect for the AQA exam board. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

Click here for the full course, or visit this link: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Culture: Global Culture 🌎 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
In this episode, Emma looks at the concept of global culture for your A Level Sociology exam. She goes through the phenomenon of globalisation and its effect on culture around the world. She also looks at the concepts of Americanisation and hybridisation. Perfect for the AQA exam board. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

Click here for the full course, or visit this link: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Culture: Mass Culture 📺 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
Emma's back with everything you need to know about mass culture for your A Level Sociology exam. She goes through the Post-modern and Marxist perspectives on mass culture. Perfect for the AQA exam board. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

Click here for the full course, or visit this link: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Culture: Dominant Cultures & Subcultures 👩‍🎤 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
In this episode, Emma looks at the definition of culture, as well as the Marxist and Feminist views on what is the dominant culture in our society. She also looks at the formation of subcultures, folk cultures, and the difference between high and low culture. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

Click here for the full course, or visit this link: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Educational Policies: Government Policies in Education 🏫 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
Emma looks at the different educational policies introduced by the Conservative government of the 1980s and 1990s, through the Labour governments of 1997 to 2010, up to the coalition government from 2010 to 2015. She looks at the differences in funding, standardised testing and school performance targets. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

Click here for the full course, or visit this link: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Educational Policies: Privatisation & Marketisation 💰 - A Level Sociology Learning & Revision
item.description:
Emma looks at the concepts of neoliberalism and globalisation on the privatisation and marketisation in schools. She also looks at the difference between endogenous and exogenous privatisation. Ideal for preparing you for your A Level Sociology exam.

Click here for the full course, or visit this link: http://bit.ly/30id5tm

item.title: Sociology A Level Paper 3 – The Night Before Podcast
item.description: It’s the last of the Sociology exams - you’re nearly there! Join Le-My for some last-minute tips, tricks, and stress busters before A Level Sociology Paper 3 tomorrow. Le-My will be delving into Functionalists'  views on crime, looking at how gender plays a role in the social distribution of crime, and lastly, exploring Foucault's ideas on prevention & punishment. For more info visit https://www.senecalearning.com/
item.dc:creator: Seneca Learning Revision
item.itunes:summary: It’s the last of the Sociology exams - you’re nearly there! Join Le-My for some last-minute tips, tricks, and stress busters before A Level Sociology Paper 3 tomorrow. Le-My will be delving into Functionalists'  views on crime, looking at how gender plays a role in the social distribution of crime, and lastly, exploring Foucault's ideas on prevention & punishment. For more info visit https://www.senecalearning.com/

item.title: Night Before the Exam - A Level Sociology Paper 1 Revision
item.description: Freedom is in sight! The exam's nearly over, but join Jono for one final push as he HyperCrams some key topics for the A Level Sociology Paper 1 exam. Processes in schools? Covered. Educational policies? Check. Research surveys and experimental methods? Deciphered. Hotel? Trivago.  For more info visit www.senecalearning.com.
